detaileddescription.para: Compute the hash value for a term.

simplesect.para: The hash value of the term.

detaileddescription.para: Get the kind of a term.

simplesect.para: The kind of the given term.

detaileddescription.para: Get the child terms of a term.
Returns NULL if given term does not have children.

parameterdescription.para: Output parameter, stores the number of children of term.

simplesect.para: The children of term as an array of terms.

detaileddescription.para: Get the indices of an indexed term.
Requires that given term is an indexed term.

parameterdescription.para: Output parameter, stores the number of indices of term.

simplesect.para: The indices of term as an array of indices.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is an indexed term.

simplesect.para: True if term is an indexed term.

detaileddescription.para: Get the sort of a term.

simplesect.para: The sort of the term.

detaileddescription.para: Get the index sort of an array term.
Requires that given term is an array or an array store term.

simplesect.para: The index sort of the array term.

detaileddescription.para: Get the element sort of an array term.
Requires that given term is an array or an array store term.

simplesect.para: The element sort of the array term.

detaileddescription.para: Get the domain sorts of a function term.
The domain sorts are returned as an array of sorts of size `size. Requires that given term is an uninterpreted function, a lambda term, an array store term, or an ite term over function terms.

parameterdescription.para: The size of the returned array. Optional, NULL is allowed.

simplesect.para: The domain sorts of the function term.

detaileddescription.para: Get the codomain sort of a function term.
Requires that given term is an uninterpreted function, a lambda term, an array store term, or an ite term over function terms.

simplesect.para: The codomain sort of the function term.

detaileddescription.para: Get the bit-width of a bit-vector term.
Requires that given term is a bit-vector term.

simplesect.para: The bit-width of the bit-vector term.

detaileddescription.para: Get the bit-width of the exponent of a floating-point term.
Requires that given term is a floating-point term.

simplesect.para: The bit-width of the exponent of the floating-point term.

detaileddescription.para: Get the bit-width of the significand of a floating-point term.
Requires that given term is a floating-point term.

simplesect.para: The bit-width of the significand of the floating-point term.

detaileddescription.para: Get the arity of a function term.
Requires that given term is a function term.

simplesect.para: The arity of the function term.

detaileddescription.para: Get the symbol of a term.

simplesect.para: The symbol of term. NULL if no symbol is defined.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if the sorts of two terms are equal.

simplesect.para: True if the sorts of term0 and term1 are equal.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is an array term.

simplesect.para: True if term is an array term.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a constant.

simplesect.para: True if term is a constant.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a function.

simplesect.para: True if term is a function.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a variable.

simplesect.para: True if term is a variable.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a value.

simplesect.para: True if term is a value.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a bit-vector value.

simplesect.para: True if term is a bit-vector value.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a floating-point value.

simplesect.para: True if term is a floating-point value.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a rounding mode value.

simplesect.para: True if term is a rounding mode value.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a Boolean term.

simplesect.para: True if term is a Boolean term.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a bit-vector term.

simplesect.para: True if term is a bit-vector term.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a floating-point term.

simplesect.para: True if term is a floating-point term.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a rounding mode term.

simplesect.para: True if term is a rounding mode term.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a term of uninterpreted sort.

simplesect.para: True if term is a term of uninterpreted sort.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is Boolean value true.

simplesect.para: True if term is a Boolean value true.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is Boolean value false.

simplesect.para: false if term is a Boolean value false.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a bit-vector value representing zero.

simplesect.para: True if term is a bit-vector zero value.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a bit-vector value representing one.

simplesect.para: True if term is a bit-vector one value.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a bit-vector value with all bits set to one.

simplesect.para: True if term is a bit-vector value with all bits set to one.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a bit-vector minimum signed value.

simplesect.para: True if term is a bit-vector value with the most significant bit set to 1 and all other bits set to 0.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a bit-vector maximum signed value.

simplesect.para: True if term is a bit-vector value with the most significant bit set to 0 and all other bits set to 1.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a floating-point positive zero (+zero) value.

simplesect.para: True if term is a floating-point +zero value.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a floating-point value negative zero (-zero).

simplesect.para: True if term is a floating-point value negative zero.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a floating-point positive infinity (+oo) value.

simplesect.para: True if term is a floating-point +oo value.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a floating-point negative infinity (-oo) value.

simplesect.para: True if term is a floating-point -oo value.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a floating-point NaN value.

simplesect.para: True if term is a floating-point NaN value.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a rounding mode RNA value.

simplesect.para: True if term is a roundindg mode RNA value.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a rounding mode RNE value.

simplesect.para: True if term is a rounding mode RNE value.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a rounding mode RTN value.

simplesect.para: True if term is a rounding mode RTN value.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a rounding mode RTP value.

simplesect.para: True if term is a rounding mode RTP value.

detaileddescription.para: Determine if a term is a rounding mode RTZ value.

simplesect.para: True if term is a rounding mode RTZ value.

detaileddescription.para: Get Boolean representation of given Boolean value term.

simplesect.para: Boolean representation of value term.

detaileddescription.para: Get string representation of Boolean, bit-vector, floating-point, or rounding mode value term.

This returns the raw value string (as opposed to bitwuzla_term_to_string(), which returns the SMT-LIB v2 representation of a term). For example, this function returns "010" for a bit-vector value 2 of size 3, while bitwuzla_term_to_string() returns "#b010".

parameterdescription.para: The base in which the output strings are given; 2 for binary, 10 for decimal, and 16 for hexadecimal.

simplesect.para: String representation of the value term.

The returned string for floating-point values is always the binary IEEE-754 representation of the value (parameter base is ignored). Parameter base always configures the numeric base for bit-vector values, and for floating-point values in case of the tuple of strings instantiation. It is always ignored for Boolean and RoundingMode values.
Return value is valid until next bitwuzla_term_value_get_bv call.

memberdef.argsstring: (BitwuzlaTerm term, const char **sign, const char **exponent, const char **significand, uint8_t base)
memberdef.name: bitwuzla_term_value_get_fp_ieee

detaileddescription.para: Get string of IEEE 754 standard representation of given floating-point value term.

parameterdescription.para: Output parameter. String representation of the sign bit.
Output parameter. String representation of the exponent bit-vector value.
Output parameter. String representation of the significand bit-vector value.
The base in which the output strings are given; 2 for binary, 10 for decimal, and 16 for hexadecimal.

simplesect.para: Return values sign, exponent and significand are valid until next bitwuzla_term_value_get_fp_ieee call.

detaileddescription.para:
Get representation of given rounding mode value term.
term
The rounding mode value term.
The BitwuzlaRoundingMode representation of the given rounding mode value.

Get the SMT-LIB v2 string representation of a term.
A string representation of the given term.
The returned char* pointer is only valid until the next bitwuzla_term_to_string call.

Print term in SMT-LIB v2 format.
term
The term.
file
The file to print the term to.
